titleStmt.title: Letter from William F. Cody to R. F. Elwell, June 29 [1912]

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

notesStmt.note: Letter is addressed to Robert Farrington Elwell. The year 1912 was determined using the routes list: BBWW&PBGFE performed in Zanesville, Ohio, 29 June 1912.

bibl.author: Cody, William Frederick, 1846-1917
bibl.title: Letter from William F. Cody to R. F. Elwell

msIdentifier.repository: McCracken Research Library, Buffalo Bill Center of the West

supportDesc.support: Buffalo Bill's Wild West Combined with Pawnee Bill's Great Far East letterhead

opener.note: Buffalo Bill's Wild West Combined With Pawnee Bill's Great Far East.
opener.salute:
The Elwells2
My Very Dear Friends

div1.p: So glad to get your letters and know that you are well and prosperous. But still the Call of the Wild is in your hearts. How I long for the Mountains and sage brush. I cannot be truly happy away from there. MabyMaybe we may meet out in our glorious Mountains again. I am well.

postscript.p: My grand son Cody3 is at Pahaska4. and the other day killed a Bear— The help had sit up with him 3 nights

back.note: Note 1: Buffalo Bill's Wild West combined with Pawnee Bill's Great Far East performed in Zanesville, Ohio, on June 29, 1912.
Note 2: Robert Farrington Elwell (1874-1962) and his wife, Mary Ellen (Taylor) Elwell.
Note 3: Most likely William Cody Boal (1896-1962), son of Arta Cody.
Note 4: Pahaska Tepee, a hunting and tourist lodge opened by William F. Cody near the east entrance to Yellowstone National Park in 1904.
